entry.title: SUPPRESSION EFFORTS CONTINUE ON HISTORIC DOERNER TREE FIRE
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 4:10 a.m. Firefighters from the Coos Forest Protective Association are actively engaged in suppression efforts on the Doerner Fir Tree fire. entry.summary: August 18, 2025 4:00 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The Scholfield Fire remains at 50 acres and is now 43 percent contained. An update from the Coos Forest Protective Association said the fire, located southeast of Reedsport, received measurable rain on Saturday. entry.title: HOYLE ANNOUNCES OVER $16.6 MILLION FOR 15 COMMUNITY PROJECTS

entry.title: Roseburg burglar suspect entered home, cooked and ate food prior to arrest
entry.summary: A 33-year-old Roseburg man was arrested Thursday after allegedly entering a local residence where he spent several hours and cooked food for himself before he was eventually arrested, according to the Roseburg Police Department.

entry.title: Curtin Drug Bust Leads to Two Arrests, Multiple Seizures
entry.summary: Curtin drug bust nets 30 marijuana plants, meth, and firearms. Two men face charges, including manufacturing and possession. One suspect, a felon, was arrested for having guns. Six others were detained but released at the scene.

entry.title: Douglas Forest Protect Association to reduce fire danger level to 'high' starting Friday
entry.summary: Starting on Friday, the Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA) is lowering the fire danger level from extreme to high due to predicted cooler temperatures and increased humidity.
